sense.name: the legal enactment of a death penalty
sense.examples: They will transport the prisoner to the place of execution in the morning. There were videos of the dictator's execution on the Internet. A stay of execution from the governor came just minutes before the prisoner was placed into the electric chair.

sense.name: illegal, premeditated, ritualized killing of someone
sense.examples: The execution of the man's wife and children by the roadside looked like the work of a drug gang. The guerillas' execution of two news correspondents caused an international furor.

sense.name: the performance or carrying out of a task
sense.examples: The execution of this new plan will be more difficult than you think. John was found negligent in the execution of his duties as chief administrator of the hospital.

sense.name: the technique or style of doing an action
sense.examples: Skipping a stone across water is all in the execution of the wrist. The execution of such difficult spins on the ice takes years of practice.

sense.name: performance of a computer instruction
sense.examples: How many thousands of executions can this computer do in a second? Compiling the software program will speed up its execution.

sense.name: putting a legal contract into effect
sense.examples: The execution of the sale was finalized by both parties signing the contract. The execution of his grandfather's will was blocked by legal technicalities.

sense.name: a court order, short for 'writ of execution'
sense.examples: The sheriff put the deadbeat tenants out on the street by a writ of execution. The judge issued a writ of execution to recover the plaintiff's possessions.
